title: Cass
body:
So I have a question, and I want lots of feed back from anyone really.

Is Cass worth picking up? I enjoy mechanically advanced champions and I know Cass is up there when it comes to those. So is she worth learning? I'm currently gold IV. I include this because  I know there are lots of great champions like Orianna who do poorly low ELO because of how much they require organized, team play which one does not find in Yolo-queue. Is Cass like Orianna in the fact that she needs her team to be able to carry, or is she a well built mage? I know I've seen lots of QQ threads about Cass getting destroyed by the rework, however (Not to be the player fan riding pros), I've seen players like Faker do exceptionally well and exceptionally high damage with her. Now I understand the pros play a much different game than us, but the actual damage output can't change that drastically, right? Is she worth learning or should I stick to Viktor, Xerath, Vel Koz, etc?

I want to learn a solid mage because I mainly play Assasssins (Zed, Talon, Ekko mid, Diana mid) and assassins are just havung a rough time lately and I'm not finding myself having as much fun with them as I used to both in their meta and out of it. I want a mage and already can play Viktor fairly well, but I want another one. I know Cass has a very kiting playstyle that can unload damage, but is she worth bringing to the rift or is she currently not too good and someone like Vel Koz or Xerath would outshine her? 

Thanks a bunch for any positive/constructive feedback!

replies.body:
Absolutely not worth picking up if you're looking for a fair trade. The risk/reward ratio is entirely skewed to her disadvantage, now add the last wave of nerfs to the mix and you're stuck with an almost unplayable champion with crippling manacosts and horrendous mobility. 

If you lose lane, you're pretty much useless for the rest of the game without a chance of ever coming back due to her extremely binary playstyle which only works if you're ahead. I used to love her before the rework entirely ruined any diversity and viability she once had, it greatly pains me to see her in her current state now.

She is by far the hardest champion in the game while being the worst midlaner at the same time, from a statistical and personal point of view.

Doesn't she have a mana refund mechanic that nullifies her mana costs somewhat, as well as stacking tear?

The Tear only does very little to alleviate your manaproblems, you've got to remember that every single E costs almost as much as an ultimate. That's horrendously expensive. Also the mana-refund was HALVED during the last nerf thus making it almost insignificant. You already need to cast your poison abilities to trigger the reset for your E otherwise you won't be able to clear waves anyway. In the end you spend more mana than you actually gain by lasthitting all of those minions. 

The issues get a lot worse once you're expected to kill raidmonsters like drake and baron since those require a full manabar from you if you want to do anything before hitting 500 stacks and amassing a considerable amount of ap. Literally all of her ratios and numbers were nerfed during the rework and the nerfs after that only made matters worse for her. What good is a so called hypercarry if she dies as fast as her targets while lacking their inherent tankyness or safety nets (see Nasus and Vayne). She is the most disappointing champion to play as if you ask me just for being so damn frustrating.
Her rework is a huge nerf

Cass is a fine champion to pick up. She has a high skill cap but no hard counters in lane so if you play her enough you have the potential to beat every champion in lane which is something that I like about her. While there are probably stronger mages at the moment, I don't think Cass is anywhere near bad. She is mechanically demanding as well as mentally, for lack of a better term. I think she teaches a lot of important midlaner gameplay concepts. Her vulnerability to ganks means you need to be on top of your vision game and her skill shot reliance and spacing reliance calls for on-point mechanics. Her reliance on sustained damage means she can itemize differently depending on comps (Do I want raw damage to carry or something like Rylai's to bring utility to my team and help THEM carry?); same deal with her summoner spells (Is running Exhaust or Cleanse more optimal than Ignite against the enemy comp? Is Ghost a good choice here to aid in re positioning during team fights?). 

She is definitely a complex champion, but she is very rewarding to play if you learn how to play to her strengths. It may take quite a few games though to get a feel for how many Twin Fangs you can throw out per Q, when it's best to use her ultimate, how to kite with her, etc. Don't get discouraged. She's a lot of fun. :)

For yoloQ? Unfortunately not. Not because she's supposedly bad, even though she's not...  but because currently you really are at the mercy of your teammates (like Nasus)...  if they fail, feed and tilt during the early game, it's pretty much GG since it puts you so much behind that you are not able to recover and do something useful in teamfights. It's hard to play a late game carry if you never get into the late game to begin with. However if you find that in your elo, the average match length is over 35 minutes, then sure, you could give her a try.

> Is Cass like Orianna in the fact that she needs her team to be able to carry, or is she a well built mage? 

Unfortunately Cass is quite like Orianna in that regard... they both exceed in teamfights, however Cass is a bit more vulnerable. Cass needs her team to not fuk up the early game.

> Is she worth learning or should I stick to Viktor, Xerath, Vel Koz, etc?

For yoloQ, you are better off playing Viktor actually... unless you really want some challenge. ^^

Velks/Xerath and Cassiopeia bring a very different playstyle to the map. They're all immobile mages, but V&X have much longer ranges and can't be punished as easily. Cassiopeia is one of the most unforgiving mages in the game; if you get CCed by anything, you're probably dead. If you miss a single poison, you're probably dead. Her damage output is more or less unparalleled, and she's a fantastic duelist, but there are other mages who do what she does (massive sustained magic damage) safer than she does it.
